newsitem.title: USA: Bay, Time Warner in Cablevision pacts.
newsitem.headline: Bay, Time Warner in Cablevision pacts.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc said on Tuesday that Cablevision Systems Corp would use its networking solutions for the delivery of high-speed Internet services to Long Island, N.Y., subscribers to Cablevision's cable system.
Cablevision will deploy Bay Networks' LCP cable modems as the application-independent modem for its roll-out of Optimum Online. The terms of the deal were not disclosed.

In a separate release, Time Warner Inc said Cablevision would distribute Road Runner, Time Warner's broadband high-speed online service, to all of its online customers nationwide as part of its new Internet link service.
The agreement includes the provision that Cablevision Systems be the exclusive provider of Road Runner programming in the franchise areas it serves. No further details of the deal were disclosed.
Bay Networks said its LANcity division, an internetworking provider for the cable TV industry, is providing Cablevision with its LANcity Personal, or LCP, cable modems.
Cablevision announced Tuesday it launched Optimum Online, high-speed access to the Internet and online services via cable wires, to 15,000 homes in Oyster Bay, N.Y.
